title: Learning Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: NYU Langone ghosted me after a lengthy and rigorous 5 round interview process, which included a case study presentation with 10+ panel members.  All interviews were done virtually.  After all of the time and effort put into these interviews by candidates, the least NYU Langone can do is follow-up with the candidate.

title: Project Coordinator Interview

title: New Grad RN Interview

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2023

Interview Questions: my work is my signature

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2023

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Asked me a few questions about molecular genetics knowledge. Asked me if I was willing to stay on for 2 years. Asked me what coursework I had taken during undergrad. Met with the post-doc and principal investigator.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews with HR, the hiring manager, and team members. All questions are behavioral questions. Everyone is nice and friendly. They just want to learn something about you. The who process is completed in two weeks

title: Dietary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Had to go through multiple channels and 3 different people. From 1st interview to hiring was a three month process. They were either remote through zoom and the initial interview was via telephone. The process was barely 15 minutes each interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: 6 weeks in total. Long wait time between final interview and offer ~ 3 weeks. Two virtual interviews, each about 30 minutes in length. The interview questions were fairly easy and straightforward compared to other NYU position interviews.
Interview Questions: What are some ideas you can bring to the program?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions:
Had five interviews for an Administrative Assistant job. The people I interviewed with were all friendly, though they all asked very similar questions and it seemed like they didn't coordinate with each other prior to their interviews. The first four interviews were about an hour long each, I was given a lot of information about the organization. 

Final interview was very short, the interviewer just asked what my life plan was. At the very end of the final interview, he asked me for a writing sample, though the job posting never indicated that this would be part of the application. 

I sent samples the next day and then I did not hear anything for two weeks. I emailed to inquire about the status of my application, and the final interviewer's assistant answered within 10 minutes saying that I did not get the job. It is clear if I had not emailed, they would have never bothered to let me know. 

To sum up: Interviewers were all fairly nice, questions were all fairly easy. However, to not even send a courtesy email after five interviews to let a candidate know they had not been chosen shows a clear disregard for the time of their job applicants. All in all, it was negative experience, and I would strongly urge jobseekers who value their time to avoid applying.
Interview Questions:
-What is the trajectory of your life? What is your plan? 
-How are you at multitasking? 
-Are you good at prioritizing? 
-Biggest strengths and weaknesses? 
-What about this job in particular interests you?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Boynton Beach, FL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Simple easy interview questions , great team of experts. HR Will call you first then if they like you they’ll schedule a in person interview on site at the local office that’s near you
Interview Questions: How will your last employer describe you in 3 words?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: First interview is with the HR, then the hiring supervisor. HR interview is very straightforward, including walking through the resume. Hiring supervisor interview may vary depending on your job responsibilities
Interview Questions: Why Langone? How did you overcome challenges at workplace?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: my interview was online, every was super nice and made me feel really calm. They were informative and talked about the process. There were a good amount of behavioral questions
Interview Questions: when was a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Senior Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied through NYU Langone and was contacted about a week after applying by the hiring manager. She set up a zoom interview with me. The interview was very easy going and I actually enjoyed my meeting with her. I was then invited to meet with the provider I would be supporting, unfortunately, he had been called into the OR so I met him but it was very brief. I met with the team lead and covering secretary, and again the interview was very casual and enjoyable. The next step was references which I obtained and a skill surgery was sent to each one. This took a little longer than expected because on of my references was away on vacation. I also needed to complete a admin skills test which tested how well I knew Microsoft Word and Excel. Once that was done, a couple of days later I was called with an offer and also told I needed to interview with HR.
Interview Questions: How do you handle distractions in the office? Tell me about yourself. Why are you looking to leave your current position?

title: Associate Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview through referral, there's low chances of them replying if you do not have referral. It has been a month and seems like the company is ghosting instead of giving a straight yes or No.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Data Science Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: First, submitted application online and set up the interview via virtual meeting. Talk about your background, your interest in to introduce yourself and about this role. And the waiting the next steps for second rounds.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions:
I believed I did well because I answered all the questions they have to ask me. Is so disappointing that administrative manager who wrote back to me: ****** uses Epic and schedules surgeries in Open case, she wasn’t presentable it was hard understanding her when she spoke. She will not be considered for the position. 
I was wearing a black blazer along with a white top for virtual interview. If she had hard time understanding me when I spoke, how she knows I schedule surgeries under open cases and uses EPIC. She should say something that she had difficulty hearing me. Sounds like BS to me. Are you expecting me to wear a ballgown to your interview? As a manager writing this message to me on an email sound very unprofessional and rude.

This is my first time hearing from someone that I was presentable.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me the last time you have difficulty with a patient or a surgeon?

I had three 30 minute interviews: first with the hiring manager, second with the person who was formerly in the role and had recently transferred, and third with a central finance employee who works with the hiring manager. All three were pleasant and the interviews were more conversations rather than questions and answers. All three interviews were scheduled within two weeks of the department first reaching out to me. I received an offer 10 days after the last interview. From submitting the application to receiving an offer was 32 days.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview

title: Business Manager Interview

Focused more on behavioral questions instead of technical questions. Everyone was friendly b

title: General Staff Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a shock how blunt management was about how they were not hiring anyone with too much outside responsibilities aka if you have a family or personal obligations like sick family member to take care of, kids, personal medical issues, mental health, etc. they weren’t to happy when asked about bereavement and PTO availability either so heads up. This would be a problem for any normal adult. Spoke with a nurse after. Confirmed the issues mentioned
Interview Questions: Can you commit everyday including weekends(even though it states 9-5 m-f). Manager admitted to working on weekends when it isn’t necessary…..

Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for about 15 minutes, then after that a scheduled 30 minute interview to meet with the managers, and then a in person interview with the team. Multiple questions being asked about how you'd work with a team.

title: Intern Interview

Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a 40 minute interview that consisted of an introduction of self and the floor/patient population. Half of the interview was the basic and expected questions as listed below, but the other half were clinical questions. Maybe this was because I applied to a critical care floor; I don't know if this is the same format as other NYU Langone RN interviews. They gave me a case study about a patient and a brief medical history. They asked me what I would do in this situation, what labs the Dr would order, what labs are expected to be abnormal, what the labs indicate, how their past medical history correlated to their clinical exacerbation. Then they asked me about a difficult clinical experience I have had and asked what I would do differently in terms of medical care/ management (not about making them comfortable but what oxygen devices I would utilize and why the Dr would order a test to verify XYZ).
Interview Questions: - tell me about yourself - why the interest in this floor? - what were your involvements? - when did you go above and beyond for a pt? - what makes a good nurse?

They treat people who are not educated at their “prestigious” institution like crap

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health

title: Clinical Laboratory Technician Interview

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: 5 interviews, none technical. Straighforward. I found, surprisingly and unexpectedly, that the people were not as friendly as one would expect from a world class hospital. I had doubts about their company culture and how well they treat their employees.
Interview Questions: What do you expect to get out of this job.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very professional and straightforward. Asked questions like tell me about yourself, tell me about some of your clinical experiences, what is your 5 year plan. Be prepared for your answers beforehand!
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Tell me about your clinical experiences
What is your 5 year plan
Unemployment gap

title: Associate Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: They primarily ask what you bring to the table. The more past experience the better. A masters degree definitely helps. Also any specific trainings or course make you a better candidate.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Grants Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter reached out when I submitted an application, asked a few questions and then a phone interview was scheduled. Then, a follow up virtual interview was scheduled.  The interviewing process took about a week and the onboarding process took another month.
Interview Questions: They asked salary expectations during the interview.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3+ interviews with several different roles within a single department. It seemed as if administration doesn't take input from actual employees and hires based off experience regardless of how much the previous interviewers may liek you.
Interview Questions: Are there any circumstances that would prevent you from working in person?

title: Financial Analyst/FGP Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
1, Recruiter reached out 
2, Hiring Manager Interview
3, Three sets of group interviews, three interviewers per set,total 90mins
4, HR interview
5, Provide 5 references within 48 hrs
6, Another three sets of group interviews, three interviewers per set, total 90 mins

Longest interview process ever, not an enjoyable experience.
Interview Questions: Basic behaviour questions: Walk through your resume/Why do you want to leave your current role/Why NYU Langone

title: Associate Clinical Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
1. Recruiter reached out via email to confirm interest
2. 1-1 interview with 1st hiring manager 
3. Another 1-1 interview with 2nd hiring manager
4. Take home data analytics assessment to finish within 24 hours using R or SQL
5. 1-1 interview with Director

Director was condescending and said my prior work experience "was nothing."  He also praised one of the hiring managers, but claimed the 2nd hiring manager was not where he expected, thus, showing signs of favoritism. I would've accepted this job had the director been more professional and kind.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with SAS.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I took part in a series of 4 interviews with people in various roles. The interviews were generally fairly average. I would have liked a more in depth explanation of the typical work schedule.
Interview Questions: Where and when did you learn about your strengths and weaknesses?

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: pretty quick, they preferred experienced nurses. so after hearing I just graduated they wanted to end the interview as there were other more qualified people. Overall if you have experience you should get the job
Interview Questions: why you want this job

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of interviews with supervisors and teams to see if the fit was there and would align with outcomes/goals.  Interviews were held virtually using Zoom to meet and connect.
Interview Questions: Asked questions related to experience, process, and certain scenarios

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I apply for the job online, and the recruiter reached out the next day and scheduled a phone call. the call is about 10 minutes. during the call, the recruiter asks a couple of questions.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
Why do you choose NYU Langone
Why do you choose to  become a nurse?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Very well, asked a lot of questions but was not intimidating. Looks like a great place to work and thrive in. People are very friendly and helpful. Looking forward to becoming a part of it.
Interview Questions: How do you handle hard situations

title: Associate Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was 30+ days after I submitted my application for this position before the department manager contacted me. The initial interview was on Zoom, the 2nd interview was in-person. I felt at ease during the process, and it made me want to work here.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The manager was very nice and the interview was very straightforward and professional. I was able to ask questions afterward and the manager made me feel very comfortable. A lot of questions were about how you would react in certain situations. It is mostly to figure out your personality, not skill (esp if you are a new grad).
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you were in a conflict with a patient or coworker, and describe how you resolved it.

title: HCOP Summer Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Standard 30 minute interview with one of the recruiters. Pretty straight forward, but the interviewer did not have much follow up after questions were answered. Took about two weeks for a response after the interview.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Cornwall on Hudson, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy straightforward. Asked questions I expected to answer, interviewer was nice and welcoming yet stern. Was not anything other than i expected. Review some basic interview questions and prepare answers and you should be prepared
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth interview process. Extremely personable and professional staff. They made me feel comfortable and engaged in the process. I appreciated how thorough the interviewer was in regards to expectations, benefits, and culture.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about your past experiences that would allow you to perform in this role.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: initial phone interview recruiter was very encouraging, wanted to know why NYU and future career goals. She expressed how many applicants they get and that there is always a lot of interest.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10yrs

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Took 3-4 months to finish interview process and get an offer. Interview was not difficult, as long as you come prepared. You meet with minimum 2, maximum 3 people until they decide to make an offer.
Interview Questions: why do you want this job

title: Echocardiographer Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: very lengthy process, multiple interviews with different people local and out of state. very nice and professional personnel. very responsive to your questions and needs. explains the process well very. takes a long time between each phase of the interview process.
Interview Questions: What was a time you had to make a quick decision, and how did it turn out for you?

title: Clinical Research Data Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had a Zoom call with two staff members to explain the study and get a sense of my background & how well I would fit in with the team. The application process itself was a lot of work- I needed 5 references and had to complete a skills survey.

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
This was specifically for the Certification and Transfer Coordinator position with the WTC Environmental Health Center under NYU Langone Health. 

Emailed by Data Center Director to set up first interview via WebEx ~2 weeks after applying. Next was a 3-person panel interview with the certification team 1 week later. First two interviews were mostly easy generic questions, fairly informal/unstructured. Contacted for 3rd interview with  Executive Director of WTC Health ~2 weeks after.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself.
2. What you know about the WTC Health Program?
3. What experience do you have with patients? Tell me about a time you had to deal with a disgruntled patient.
4. Are you comfortable with giving feedback on how to improve WTC’s outdated database application? 
5. How do you manage when given tedious, repetitive tasks? 
6. What are your long-term goals in the next 5-10 yrs?

title: Adminitrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviews took place on Zoom. The interviewer was very kind and personable. It was more of a conversation than anything. There is an office assessment and references are required. The process was long but worth it
Interview Questions: What are  your career goals?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward and standard- met with HR and then interviewed with department leadership. Response time fast regarding offer, credentialing took a few months. HR was able to answer all questions in real time
Interview Questions: What interested you in NYU?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple. Just speak to your experiences and be prepared to answer questions about gaps in your resume.  Overall, this was one of the easiest interviews I experienced in the health field.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working as a research assistant?

title: Business Office Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview process was great. Did like the different stages from HR to the hiring manager. The breakdown on the process of hiring went well. My questions were answered with concise information from the peers.
Interview Questions: What interested you about the position you applying?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2022

Received a call the next day to set up a second zoom interview with dept administrative team which also seem to go well. Did not hear anything back from the dept, reached out to the Hiring Manager and no response.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for NYU?

title: Practice Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email about an interview for a multi-specialist practice in lower Manhattan about a week later. Ghosted after that, reached out 3 times with no response.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work at NYU?

Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
What is your experience
Where do you see yourself in 10 years
What do you do in difficult situations
How do you handle stress

How do you handle a difficult patient

Are you reliable to come in on time

Are you reliable to not call out numerous times
Why are you looking for a new job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health

title: Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I met with multiple members of the department who asked comprehensive questions regarding the Alumni Relations position for which I had applied. The interview was on par with my expectations.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for NYU?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview

I was told that if they were to move forward I would contacted in 3 weeks, which I was to come in for an in person interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to leave your current employer?
What is something that you have done that you are proud of?
Why do you want to work at NYU?

title: Admitting Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Fast. To the Point and welcoming. Just be yourself and you'll have nothing to worry about. I was able to go to the interview in my jeans because I had just finished classes nearby. They understood and I still got hired.

title: LMSW Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health

title: Research Technician Interview

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I had no fewer than 5 interviews with HR and direct hiring managers. Initial contact with HR recruiter, phone interview with direct supervisor, zoom interview with two additional managers, an in person with faculty and direct supervisors, and another HR. It was very lengthy.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took 2 weeks. 1 call with HR, one video conference with manager. Very relaxed and made me feel comfortable, offered the job 5 days later and got straight to onboarding
Interview Questions: Why nursing? Why this specialty?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Boynton Beach, FL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter found me via LinkedIn saying they had a confidential posting they wanted to discuss with me.  So after some back/forth (all via LinkedIn) I learn it's the same position they have reached out to me previously (like 3 times over the past 3-4 years) so a call is scheduled. Makes me wonder if there is something wrong with role or the company when you need to keep hiring for the same role.  Perhaps they keep hiring the wrong person instead of me!  Anyway, I thought I would entertain it and was ghosted after I mentioned I had been contacted previously.  Really tacky treatment.  Odd that they don't recognize their previous candidates, but I can see why since recruiting is a mess.  Clearly, if I was unqualified, had too high of salary expectations or whatever that won't change year to year.
Interview Questions: Basic screening questions confirming background.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Rockville Centre, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy! Received a phone call from Cornelia, and within a day i was setting up a face to face! The face to face was about 20 mins long. Two days later i was offered the position! Very friendly!!

title: Administration Interview

Interview Descriptions: The questionnaire at the application stage is tedious and most of the questions did not make sense for the position I was applying for. I thought these types of personality tests have been proven extremely biased.

title: Research Technician Interview

I found the process lengthy but the interviews themselves were very casual and more like conversation. Everyone was very welcoming.

title: Building Services Supervisor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Initially you’re contacted by the head person of the dept you’re interviewing for then if they like you HR reaches out and set another interview asking about your past jobs and experience, explain benefits, and inform you of the onboarding process (3-4 weeks) . title: Assistant to Office Manager Interview

The hiring manager worked efficiently and was very friendly, and the team couldn’t have been nicer during my interviews.

title: Fellow Interview

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Future goals

title: Project Engineer Interview

title: Grants Manager Interview

title: Data Engineer Interview

Interview Descriptions: Almost everyone in IT is Indian. The team that interviewed me is all Indians. I have Indian colleague and I enjoy working with them. However, these people who interviewed me were the rudest and most condescending people I have ever met.  At one point, I asked one of them to elaborate a question and he responded "I'm the one who's asking questions now, not you" .  The tools they use are far behind the industry and they are not looking for problem solving skills but someone who can memorize every textbook term. I d

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview

title: Customer Representative Interview

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions:
I am reviewing a part-time weekend unit clerk position interview. The first red flag was the way the recruiter articulated her email. I was a little thrown off by the casual “could you give me a call?“ To me it just felt like they were running out of applicant options and did not care but wanted to inquire about me anyway. Your professionalism speaks volumes. Maybe I am too particular, but this wasn’t the worst part. Later in the day they give me a call to schedule a remote interview five days later. They were offering $21.57 per hour, but before I knew this I was asked what my salary requirements were. To be honest I wasn’t prepared for the phone call so I ball parked and said $25 an hour to which the recruiter laughed and scoffed, and said it was not going to pay that much—okay, fine. I should also mention that during the interview the recruiter asked a lot of questions that I had already answered in my application so my advice to you is keep a copy of your application on hand and remember what you put in your application should be what you say on the phone and during the interview. Also remember what your reason for leaving your previous positions were as they will ask you this during the interview although you already put it in your application. After that phone call to schedule the interview, I was met with a bunch of emails from the recruiter with a list of tasks to complete before the interview. These tasks included sending all education transcripts, downloading WebEx (by the way I highly encourage NYU to interview using zoom communications not WebEx), and completing a “phase II” application, which was so annoying to fill out because you have to manually type out your entire résumé and if you don’t do it in one sitting it does not save and you have to start over. Although the minimum education for this position is a high school diploma, I was still asked to submit college transcripts as well as a Microsoft Word version of my résumé along with, get this— A whopping five references that needed to submit a Survey on my behalf. Honestly I thought this was so ridiculous for a part-time entry-level position.  I have family and friends in healthcare who only submitted two or three references for their higher up careers. 

What annoyed me the most was that the recruiter did not bother to really read my résumé and see that I was a recent graduate of a nursing program. During the interview, the questions were straightforward how ever I could tell with their tone they were not interested in hiring me after they just realized I was interested in becoming an RN. Then the interview became an interrogation about why I wanted this position if I was going to be an RN. Since you may be curious as well… in order to work as an RN in a magnet hospital you need to have a BSN which I am scheduled to start. As a recent nursing grad I know how expensive nursing school is and honestly just need a job. It would take me about two years to complete my bachelors so I wanted to work withing a hospital in the interim. I did not think this logic was rocket science for recruiters but apparently it is.If you had just paid attention to my résumé you would have seen this and treated my application accordingly. Or they should have asked this in the initial phone call to schedule the interview. That would’ve save me time and asking five different people for a reference. Additionally the interview was an hour with the recruiter, and scheduled for an hour with a member of the team in the unit I would have been working in. It was scheduled for two hours which also threw me off because I never in my life had a two hour interview for an entry-level position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a customer

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Multiple stages.
First interview was via phone to determine fit and areas/ units of interest. Second phone interview was to ensure credential and set up time with manager to discuss the role and unit. Final round is unit manager interview.
Interview Questions: What drove you to a career in nursing?

title: Epic Application Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: After 5 separate interviews spanning over several weeks, I was ghosted. I heard absolutely nothing. I expected better professionalism from NYU Langone. I even followed up with HR, who said they would let me know, but I only got silence.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Speaking to the hiring manager via phone, and if that goes well, you move your way to the director via video call. I honestly thought the entire process was very basic and not a lot of technical questions. The only issue is they don't get back to you about the status. I'm sure the company as a whole is great, but I think there are way better hospital employers that are far better.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
What makes you a good candidate?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume online, I got a call from a recruiter. We set up a time to interview and I had to get 5 references. My interview was very quick and relaxed, and the questions were pretty easy. My recruiter helped me through the whole hiring process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions:
My experience is with NYU Grossman. Probably the worse interview process I have ever done.  The interviewers were nice, but the HR process is horrendous. They really need to figure it out! 
1. I applied through their website and had to complete a 100 question personality multiple-choice test.
2. Contacted by a recruiter in a few days to schedule a Webex interview. 
3.  Interview with the hiring manager, which was positive and they were professional and kind.
4. After 1st interview was asked to complete a reference check via Skillshare (software where it asks for your reference email address and have them fill out a 25 question survey). I had to provide 5 reference where 3 has to be supervisors. Also, have to complete an internal application and do a ridiculous Microsoft office simulation test. Then was scheduled for a 2nd interview.
5. The second interview was with leadership and HR. The leadership was professional, but HR wasn't. She asks me a series of behavioral questions which idk why since it's not like this position would work with HR. Then told me the next steps would be a reference check, but I had already submitted it. They ended up going with another candidate and I felt like I just wasted my references' time. 
Overall, they expect you to provide so much information before you are even extended a contingent offer. I think they should really switch the reference check to once an offer has been made like what all other companies do!
Interview Questions: Questions were about the position and your skillsets.

title: Research Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very relaxed and informal, but it all depends on the PI.  It's good to be prepared with a few  questions that you want to ask. In addition to that, you should read at least one of the PI's most recent papers that has been published.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
Do you have any research experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to a recruiter on Linkedn, she forwarded my resume to the hiring recruiter for the position that fit my experience. Second recruiter got back to me a day after to schedule a Webex interview with herself and the hiring manager for the following week. Couldn’t interview with the recruiter because she was busy on another interview but she was polite about it. I went on to interview with the manager and she basically did most of the talking. She asked one or two questions and that was it. Next day, the recruiter emailed me to tell me the manager wants to move forward with me. Considering there were currently no open positions, I was placed on a wait list. I was waitlisted for almost 2 months then got an offer.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
How do you handle a stressful work environment

title: Associate Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had four interviews in total. The final one with HR and they were pretty standard interviews. They asked me about my plans for the future and about all my relevant experience.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for the future?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I did interview with HR first and manager. I did on virtual interview and it was little distracted because manager did not eye contact on me. I feel like she was not listening.
Interview Questions: tell me about your self, what you will see in 5 years?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Jun 2021

title: Technical Director of Radiation Therapy Interview

They seemed to make assumptions about my advanced degrees, experience, and career trajectory they were inaccurate.

title: Director Interview

Individuals interviewing were unprepared, took 3 months to make up their minds, and constantly changed their minds about what job I was interviewing for when I made it clear what it is that I wanted and applied for, but they are a mess.

Questions from the nurse manager were very unexpected. I shared my experience with my nursing colleagues and they agreed the questions seemed like trick questions. I did not see myself working on the unit even if I was given an offer.

title: Financial Analyst Interview

First round of interviews wasn't bad, your general questions for this type of role.  Met with 2-3 people.  Then I had a second round, it also went well and it seemed like the hiring manager wanted to offer me.  The annoying part is dealing with HR.  There is a 100 questions survey that takes about an hour I had to answer about 3 times during the process.  After my second interview I was asked to provide 5 references on 24 hours notice.  I reached out to my references and got them in but NYU never reached out and never got back to me for months later despite multiple follow up emails.  Overall not a great experience.
Interview Questions: Explain what type of excel skills you have.

title: Physical Therapist Interview

What are 3 adjectives you would use to describe yourself

I was recommended to continue in the interview process and was handed off to Recruiter 2 who scheduled a call shortly after. This call was also quick, similar conversation, but also asked for more information about what I'm looking for next in my career. This Recruiter knew of more positions, including one that was more senior than the initial role I was interviewing for, and recommended me to continue interviewing for the more senior position.

title: Patient Service Associate Interview

title: Research Regulatory Specialist Interview

Than in October there was a  second zoom interview with 3 department & program heads. Each conversation was 20 minutes long back to back.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Why do you want to be a nurse?
What units?

title: Dietary Interview

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview

title: Data Interview

title: Opthalmic Tech Interview

title: Administrative Interview

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 9 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The Talent Acquisition/Recruitment Hiring/Application Review process is absolutely horrible. Not a great place to 
apply to at all. 

Hire more qualified Recruiters to attract and recruit talent.  Clean up your Staff. Is this Recruiter the only one there reviewing and rejecting all applications? 

I guess the hiring process would go more smoothly if you knew someone on the inside. Discouraging. Complete turn off.  

The higher ups need to investigate why this is happening. A Great Place To Work shouldn’t have this going on in their organization. Shameful.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Medical Secretary Interview

title: Registered Dental Assistant Interview

title: Medical Assistant Interview

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Research Data Associate Interview

title: RN Interview

title: Staff RN Interview

title: Psychologist Interview

title: Physical Therapist Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in May right after I graduated nursing school. Was then told they couldnt hire anyone without an RN license, so to keep in contact when I passed my NCLEX. Once I did, it took weeks for someone to get back to me only for them to tell me they were "waiting for positions to open". Its been months and have not heard from them since.
Interview Questions: What are the 3 qualities you believe a nurse should have?

title: Research Data Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I cold-called the PI of the study I wanted to work on because I was frustrated by the lack of response by HR throughout the recruitment process. I went and met with the PI a few days later and he said he would love to have me on the team, however, it would be up to HR whether or not they wanted to hire me and saw me as a good fit for the company (School of Medicine). This was over two months ago. I assumed HR had gone in a different direction. Two weeks ago, I got an email asking for references and to fill out an internal application. I was also invited for an in-person interview. The interview was quick, since I had already met with the PI and he had given me a lot of information regarding the position. I still had to answer around 5 or 6 behavioral interview questions, which weren’t hard if you use the STAR method. Two days later I got a call saying I was chosen for the position and was to begin the onboarding process. Overall, it was 2+ month long process and between those two months HR is not really responsive, but I am glad I waited.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time where you handled a situation you were not equipped for?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Apply for position(s) online. Personality questionnaire. No response to any job applications. No response to general inquiries. Spoke with various authorities within organization. No actionable help regarding process or timeline.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Data Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: First interview is with HR, which was well organized and quick. Second interview was with senior management which was disorganized and more of a conversation than a Q&A. Overall, senior management never took the time to review my resume. I got the job and ignored the red flags and regret going against my better judgement.
Interview Questions: HR asked standard questions regarding my past experience. Senior management did not ask questions but just talked the entire time about expectations.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to come in for an interview that went well., I discussed my hours of availability as I am currently I school for my RN. Then I was asked to come back that same week to meet the medical director and the practice administrator. That also went well, I received a call that same day to meet with HR the following week. That went well! I was in there, then the department called me to inform me of the schedule I would be going into unfortunately the schedule did not mesh well with my school schedule and I had to the decline the offer, even though I was told I can choose from 3 schedules which one best suites my needs. I was a little disappointed as I believe it shouldn’t have went this far all the way to the end only to be told a schedule they knew I could not do from the first interview.
Interview Questions:
How did you handle a time with a difficult employee?
Why are you leaving your job ?
Why NYU?
How was your transition inpatient to outpatient ?

title: Senior Staff Nurse Interview

title: Volunteer Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview (4 people) and the interviewer had us fill out a paper that asked for basic personal information. Distributed papers  about the requirements along with other things.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a distressed patient?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
This interview process has scared me for all future job searches. The process was long, old fashion, and demoralizing. The process took over 2 months during which they asked me to come in 4 different occasions to interview/meet multiple people (all normal and fine), rescheduled/no show interviewers the day and time of the meeting, and had me travel to multiple locations the same day for interviews. I was assured that I was the front runner for the position but I didn't want to get ahead of myself until meeting with HR, but then I met with HR at the last round of interviews, went through background checks, and sent in my references. I didn't hear anything back about next steps. Only to find out that they went with another candidate after I had to reach out to ask what was the hold-up. 

Fun little thing to add to this experience~ turns out they hired someone for this position TWO months BEFORE my first interview.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult people

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2019

Interview Descriptions: Had phone interview with HR in early Nov. recruiter told me positions would start to open in mid Jan. Landed interview in early Feb. Name a time you were in a crisis and how  you dealt with it?
Did you ever have a coworker you didn't like?

title: Nursing Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2019

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, several in-person interviews with different members of the team, long HR screening and background check process, mandatory medical clearance (appointment with NYU health center to clear you, even if you are not interacting with patients). Long gap between when you receive a verbal offer and when you can actually start.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in medical academia?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
My interview process at NYU Langone was very professional yet personal. It left me excited and eager to work for this company. The process took about 4 weeks. My employment process was the following:

Phone interview 
Face to face interview with program directors 
Reference checking
IT testing (Microsoft programs test; [Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Typing])
Background check
Medical and Physical examination for clearance

One I got cleared, I was invited to the orientation. Overall, it was a positive experience. My advice going on an interview with this company is to do your research on the company, smile, make eye contact and engage yourself, sort of like you're having a conversation, rather than an interview. Please bring and ask questions relevant to the job and company to the interview. Lastly, show your enthusiasm and excitement for the position. Also send out thank you emails.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied: September and got a call back in about two days. Phone Interview: November, and was told to come in for a new grad interview event. It never happened. Then I was told I needed to pass my NCLEX first and then reach back to them. I passed my NCLEX in late Feb and reached back out to HR and nothing was opened. After weeks of waiting, I was told to contact them again and I did but only one position was opened. Heres my thing: even if you dont want it, go for it, get your foot in the door! NYU is not an easy place to get a job at. Take what you can get! The HR team will help you even if the NM (nurse manager) didn't hire you. I was told to come in for an interview, and get all of my references ready (5 references). I came in, took a math test (need to score 100%), then had an interview with HR. Afterwards, I had a direct interview with a NM. Found out the next day that I didnt get it but my HR lady was awesome and scheduled me for an interview for the very next day for another unit. I got the job! The whole process took September - April (but it really took March - April because I think they prefer us to pass before we even get interviews). Overall, my interview process was great. Nothing was overwhelming or challenging..all basic questions.
Interview Questions:
HR
1. Why NYU?  
2. Tell me about your experience base off your resume? 
3. What type of units do you find yourself working with? 
4. What was a time where you felt like no one respected you and you had to stand up for yourself?
5. Tell me about a time where you went out of your way for a patient.
6. Tell me about a stressful situation and how you handled it?
7. Tell me about a time where you had a patient who was causing problems on the unit and how you handled it.
8. Why this unit? 
9. Tell me about a time where you went above and beyond for a patient?
10. Tell me about a time where you had to advocate for a patient?
11. Why should I hire you? 
12.  What makes a nurse a good to you? (Be ready to provide an example after you explain to her what qualities make a good nurse). 
13. Tell me about a time where you showed team work. 
14. How would you handle criticism if someone told you did something wrong and you didn’t think it was wrong? 
Hope this helps!

title: FGP Transcriptionist Interview
