Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the NYU Langone website. Completed the application form online with resume and cover letter. Then, waited several weeks to hear back from HR to do a phone screen/ interview me for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy, I don't think my manager had much experience in interviewing so no trick questions. He just basically asked me about my experience, what had I done thus far, what were my expectations and views of the population we would be working with.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult questions

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process: two phone interviews, as well as in person interviews on two occasions with four different people. Took over a month for the process; got all the way to discussing salary and benefits with HR then just received their standard unsigned email rejection letter with no explanation. Seems like a great place to work and they were nice enough in person but I found an impersonal boiler plate email to be a bit rude considering how much of my time I had given them. Tip: HR has a great deal of power in the hiring process--when you go in it will be another serious job interview so be prepared to answer a great deal of questions about your work experience and personality for an hour.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where a you worked with a coworker who wasn't a 'team player' and how you handled it

title: Clinical Reviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: interview was brief, formal, personality questions, re action in work situations questions, collection of all the documentation, and sometimes duplicating actions as few people in the HR seemed to be handling the hire process.
Interview Questions: How would you address a conflict situation?

title: Family Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with program director and a family support worker for the first interview. The interview went well and smoothly, they were both very patient and interested in my experience. Been contacted by the HR a week after the first interview asking for references.
Interview Questions: What was one of the biggest challenge you ever had in your work?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Did a brief but fast paced phone interview, went to New Graduate Interview Day which was a room full of many new grad nurses, nurse managers, and HR staff. Was 2 hours long but only talked for about 30 minutes total. Only issue was that it took awhile for them to get back to me.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you disagreed with a coworker but ended up succeeding

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Someone from HR contacted me to have a phone interview. They were pleasant and very nice. They explained what the position was and what they were expecting. They asked very generic questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Mineola, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by a recruiter for an interview. Interview went well. Waited a few days then sent a thank you email,  only for the recruiter to claim she emailed me a week ago to say I was not chosen. Never received said email.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Mineola, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a call within 3 days of applying from HR. I had no family/ friend connections. Scheduled an interview for the following week. I interviewed for about 25 mins with HR, then I went up to the floor that I applied to and interviewed with the Nurse Manager & Nurse Manager Assistant. They showed me the unit and then told me I got the job. They also mentioned how they usually call you after the interview to tell people.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose nursing (bc I am a nursing student)?

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview with NYU prior to being called for the business associate position. My first interview was for a receptionist position in westchester county. Interview went well, I was interviewed by the incoming supervisor and the director of the department. The Director felt I was over qualified for a receptionist position so she referred me for another position within NYU. Fast forward two weeks later I was called for the business office associate position in the city. I was sent a confirmation interview for 2pm. I left work that day early to make it to my interview. Before you go to your interview you must go to HR first and meet with a recruiter. NYU is very unprofessional. When I arrived at the Human Resources office I was told my recruiter called out sick so I will have to meet with another recruiter, although she was nice she didn’t know much about the position or the time of my interview. I showed her my email she told me to proceed to the main hospital for a interview with the supervisor of the department, I arrived at the site at 1:45pm, asked for the supervisor and when the supervisor came to greet me she told me I was 45 mins late. I explained to her that my email stated my interview was at 2pm, show her my emailed and she said that wasn’t her problem and dismissed me, after numerous calls to Human Resources and the recruiter no one followed up with me . 3 months after this horrific experience I was called for another position with NYU that I turned down. Never will I deal with this unprofessional organization again
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply for this position ?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Chatted about my work and school experience. Talked about how volunteering at Lutheran fit into my long-term career goals. It was a very friendly discussion, mostly just to get to know what type of person I am.
Interview Questions: Since I am bilingual, I was asked how well I speak my non-native language.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was seamless. I interviewed with HR and the hiring managers in the same day. Both lasted about 30 minutes. The questions asked were quite generic. Received an offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had to work with an irate customer.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Mineola, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was about 30 minutes long. I did have to wait as the previous interview ran overtime. The manager was nice, very respectful and warming. She explained what would be expected for the position, overtime may be optional. Stressed you must work every weekend and holiday.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5/10/15 years?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews; one phone interview with the P.I, Panel interview and H.R.  The initial interview was a phone interview followed by two in-person interviews. I did not get an offer but would have preferred a less generic response
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The person who interviewed me from HR was extremely nice. She wasn’t intimidating and didn’t try to ask super difficult questions. There was a lot of paper work and you had to get mandatory shots (even though I wasn’t working in the hospital, but an off site office building.)
Interview Questions: What are your 2 strengths?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: They are very quick to respond and reply to you with updates! The interview was with 6 people on the team, which I thought was overwhelming at first, but they were very friendly and the interviews felt more like conversations than daunting.
Interview Questions: What part of the job description made you want to apply?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The entry level RA position required a single interview with the lead of the project, asked me about my experience and skills as well as career trajectory. My interviewer was very pleasant and easygoing.
Interview Questions: What is your career trajectory, how does this position fit in your career path?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was more scenario base questions. They would ask you questions and you would have to answer and give examples from your previous work experiences. The questions would start with describe me a time when....
Interview Questions: Describe a time at work where you had to deal with a difficult customer or patient? And how did you overcome it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for an RN position. I completed the online battery test and was scheduled to meet with an HR rep as well as to   have an interview with the the charge nurse. The RN medication test was easy and the interview with the charge nurse was pleasant and informal. I was then called by HR to plan a second interview with the practice administrators approximately two weeks later.  This  interview also went well and I was told by the practice administrator and the charge nurse that I would get a call within the week regardless if I did  or did not get the position.  A week went by without a response so I called the practice administrator and he informed me that there were still more applicants that need to be interviewed and again he will call me by the end of the week to inform me if I got the position. Early the following week, I still had not received any communication with the practice administrator or charge nurse. My "thank you for the interview" email went unacknowledged. Four weeks after my second interview I called the talent acquisition rep and inquired about the position. She said they went with another applicant but I interviewed well. She also apologized that she forgot to send me an email informing me of this news before she left on a two week vacation.  Overall, a negative time-wasting experience.
Interview Questions: The questions were standard. Why do you want to work here? What  makes you a good candidate? etc.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Process was 4+ weeks. Was invited in to speak with the department (5 members of the team). During the interview they asked me the basic interview questions (why do you want this opportunity/what skills do you possess). Asked a couple of coding questions that were pretty basic but very random i.e. what is an array? how would you write a script for this in javascript?
Interview Questions: What is an array?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions:
The job was listed online directly by the professor, so I heard back within two weeks about the interview. The research labs for NYU Langone and the Medical School are in the hospital complex, so you need to travel to the East River waterfront from the 33rd Street stop on the Lexington Avenue subway line. The bus was taking an epic time to arrive, so I ended up walking. It was a long hike. I encountered a disturbing array of vagrants on my walk, which I later realized was probably related to the thousand bed men’s homeless shelter right next to the hospital complex. I did not feel safe.

The interviews themselves were unstructured and consisted of an interview with the professor and a separate interview with a current research technician. I had done undergraduate research and had published citations, so the professor had already contacted my mentor for a reference.

The professor was really looking for someone to stay for the long term, noting that career research technicians were a standard arrangement in her native country. But since the position was funded by short term grants and was at-will employment, she couldn’t guarantee any level of stability. I could be fired at any time for any reason - or no reason at all.

She was also concerned about my ability to work with the rodents used in her research. As my resume clearly reflected, I had no prior experience regularly killing, skinning, and dissecting rats. I honestly had no idea how I’d react to being bitten or scratched by rats while performing experiments on them. 

The research technician was an Ivy League humanities major who was preparing to apply to medical school. The professor told me she hired the research technician because of her elite credentials - in spite of her lack of scientific knowledge or experience. The current technician was a pleasant interviewer, but I had to lead the conversation.
 
I never heard back. But given my lack of rat killing experience and the professor’s fixation with graduates of elite universities, I wasn't surprised or disappointed. The NYU research technician salary really isn't enough to cover the cost of rent, transportation, and food in New York - particularly if you have student loans - even if you lived in a sketchy neighborhood requiring a long commute.
Interview Questions: Are you sure you'd be ok working with rats?

title: Information Security Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Mineola, NY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: My recruiter called to tell me that the CSO wanted to interview in person without going through a phone screen because the position was open for over 5 months at the time. Went onsite was interviewed by HR representative then by  CSO. Was surprised that while HR was in a well kept office the information security offices felt more like a warehouse with scuffed paint and old furniture. The interview started on an intimidating note. To paraphrase CSO said that he would ask a lot of questions and some people have trouble with his approach so if I did feel well I should just ask to step out and take a drink of water. This sounded like it was going to be a stress interview but despite lasting about an hour and a half I didn't didn't feel unwell and didn't need to leave  the room. All told it was a discussion of controls as well as challenges within the organization. On that score there was a surprising amount of candor about the difficulties of working with the various physicians offices. Once interview was over was asked to go back to HR where  the rep told me that unlike other employers hospital policy was the I would hear back from them either way. No surprise - I didn't hear back from them at all.
Interview Questions: If you had an unlimited budget what controls would you implement?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: In person interview at the research lab - asked me if I had basic knowledge of stats, medicine, etc. It was not anything crazy, they just wanted to make sure I had base knowledge of the things we'd be working with in research.
Interview Questions: Do you have familiarity with Biostats?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with other camp counselor applicants at the NYU Child Study Center. This interview was for a position as a counselor for the summer program for kids, an evidence-based treatment program for children with ADHD and behavioral disorders.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to be a part of the program and how I found it?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Overall it was pretty straight forward. The first round interview I met with the Finance Director and with someone from NYU's central HR office. A few hours later that day, I received an email to come in the following week to meet the other financial analyst and a grants specialist  and the Department Administrator.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went in for an interview to be a volunteer over the summer. The interview was a very casual conversation to get to know more about you and your lifestyle.
Interview Questions: Why NYU Lutheran?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I knew the position through school post. 
There was only one interview with recruiter and PI. 
The PI introduced projects they worked on and asked me about my software skills and interests.
Interview Questions: details about the research experience in the resume

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for job online, received an email asking for an interview.   Started with a phone conversation, then I was asked for an in-person interview.  Received the job offer later that week but turned it down for personal reasons.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Billing Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through indeed and less than a week I was emailed from an administrative coordinator expressing interest as well as providing two days with times to come in and interview with the director of the department . One week letter I was emailed my the same employee asking to reschedule with a new time / same date . I arrived there and meet with the billing coordinator . The duration of the interview was about thirty minutes . It's been two weeks and I haven't heard anything . The interview was pleasant however I find it to be very unprofessional that I wasn't informed properly I wasn't selected to move onto the next interview process. I understand there are hundreds of applicants that apply for a position however the ones that are selected for an interview should be provided with proper notification of their application/ interview status. Some candidates travel a long way , do research on position as well as prepare interview questions . 

I sent an email and called once a few days later . No feedback provided.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you ?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I had my interview with HR in the morning where I took a dug calculation test, then had my interview with HR which was a few questions and then a lot of information about salary, benefits, vacation, etc. Then I went immediately to the hospital for my interview with the nurse manager, which consisted of a few questions and then I was given a lot of information about the unit. After that, the nurse manager sent me on a unit tour with a few other staff members who also asked me a few questions. 10 days later I got an official offer.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time you felt challenged?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I had to present my PhD project. It was a 1 hour presentation followed by meeting and interview with lab members. It was all day event but went well. I heard about the result the following week.
Interview Questions: What do you expect of the job?

title: Administrative Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were very straightforward. I initially had a phone interview. The following week I met with the manager of the facility. We discussed the position, toured the facility, and went through a list of questions. The interview took a little over a hour and I thought it went well. The next week I met with the HR rep for about 15 minutes. She ran through another list of questions, made a copy of what she needed and informed me that a decision would be made, regarding which candidates would be moving forward to reference checks, in a few days (I got the impression that they wanted to fill the position sooner rather than later). A week later I heard nothing and reached out via phone. I left a message and didn't get a callback. A week after that I sent an e-mail and still nothing. At this point I assume I didn't get the job which is fine. I only wish they would have been courteous enough to say that or at least update my application status on their website.  Overall, the staff seemed nice, the facility was aesthetically pleasing to the eye but the followthrough was definitely lacking.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a bad call...

title: Assistant Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the PI who then hired me the same day. The HR process is painstakingly long. The HR staff move slowly and were not particularly responsive via email or telephone.
Interview Questions: What was one instance where you went above and beyond?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: You undergo 3 rounds of interviews, 2 with the team, 1 with the director/assistant director.  Pretty run of the mill questions. Absolutely no curveballs. Be able to speak about your experience and what you bring to the team.
Interview Questions: What efficiencies have you brought to your past teams with your Excel capabilities?

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
General Information phone interview. 

In person interview with managers and dean

They were super professional and kind. Be completely honest about your future plans. I told them I was leaving after two years and they were totally fine with it
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: My interview experience was very straight forward. I had a phone screening first, then had two back-to-back skype interviews, first with the coordinators and then with the PI/supervisor. It was a really pleasant experience. I haven't heard back yet but since it has been a few weeks, I'm assuming the position was filled by someone else.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with HR.  No follow-up.  Recruiter knew very little about the specifics of the job, she seemed rushed, distracted and uninterested.  There was no baseline understanding of how the job is defined in the healthcare industry.
Interview Questions: What are you doing now?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed up by an in-person interview in New York. Online application required a cover letter, resume, transcripts, and five references. In-person interviews were offered on an individual basis in New York, and you have to rank the top three units that you want to work on.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an email to come in for the interview two-three days later.  Prior to the interview, I took a written exam on medication administration, with a total of (25?) questions.  You need 100% to proceed onto the interview. The exam had a few tricky questions.  I'm pretty good at math, but I needed to double check my formulas.  They also provide a calculator.

I met with a woman from HR who was kind and asked basic interview questions.  An hour later, after lunch, I then met with the manager for the unit I was applying for.  Originally, it was supposed to be a panel interview, but one of supervisors could not attend due to an emergency meeting.  The manager was very receptive and informative about the job.  They were honest about the job duties and very thorough.

I was offered the job, but I declined.  When I applied online, the hours were different from what I was told in the interview.  I mentioned this, and they understood.  It must have been a technical error.  Nevertheless, the interview went smoothly, and they were very professional.  If the circumstances were different, I would have loved to work with them.  They also called me back to ask why I declined the position, and if I would change my mind.  They encouraged me to look at other nursing jobs with them, and were probably one of the best places I've interviewed with, in comparison to (NYP, Montefiore, HSS, MSKCC, and a few healthcare insurance companies).  I'm so disappointed it didn't work out!
Interview Questions:
1.  Why do you want to work at NYU?
2.  Tell us about a time where you had to go above and beyond for a patient.
3.  Tell us about a time when you had an unexpected outcome when working with a patient.
4.  What are your job responsibilities at your current job?
5.  Why do you want to leave your present position?
6.  Do you know what radiology nurses do?
7.  Why do you think you will be a good fit with our team of radiology nurses?

There were about 10-14 questions total.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward.  First, I interviewed with HR via phone, then an in-person with HR, and the hiring manager.  The hiring manager introduced me to the team, which I appreciated.  She was also very thorough in explaining the position and now it fit into the department as a whole.
Interview Questions: Experience in administrative roles

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to research at a career fair. The interview was fairly relaxed, but the interview was more that the recruiter would take my resume and then I should apply online if I see an interesting position. I'm not totally sure how much the interview helped. The recruiter was very nice and the interview more or less relaxed.
Interview Questions: Describe past research experience. What was the last time you worked with a team and how did it go? It was very relaxed, but the recruiter did not have a strong science background so that was probably the trickiest part.

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a nonspecific position and was contacted approximately four months later by the supervisor looking for a social worker.  She stated she had a position in her department and if interested she would like to arrange an interview.  CC'ed on the email was the Talent Acquisition Specialist and she stated she would also like to meet with me at the same time.  The first round of interviews was first with the Talent Acquisition Specialist and then the supervisor and another supervisor in the department.  Approximately a week later I was asked to come in and meet with the Director of the department and the executive director of the program I would mostly be working with.  I heard back approximately a week and half later regarding the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: First part was a brief phone interview asking about your resume and hourly rate expected with human resources. Then online skills assessment and then reference survey and background and medical clearance. Once all is cleared they will call you with an offer. I applied through the temp program and it is temporary assignments
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Overall I was interviewed four times. The first time I went in I was interviewed by the internship coordinator who worked in HR and the talent acquisition supervisor. Both interviews went well and I got a second call back. In the second interview I was interviewed by two different departments, both who have never interviewed someone before- had no answers to my questions. The interview questions were dry and read off a piece of paper. After FOUR interviews, I never heard back. Found this very rude and inconsiderate. An email saying I did not get the position would have been better than nothing. I spent a lot of time commuting to these interviews. Would of at least like some criticism back.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online since August and got a call from HR in November. I had 2 interviews. The first one  was with five Lead Analyst and then the second interview was with 3 managers and director. Overall was a good experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself?
Why do you want this position?
Describe what do you do at your current job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I am a new graduate nurse. A nurse recruiter reached out to me and scheduled and interview to meet with HR.  The interview lasted about 30 minutes.  She asked situational questions about my clinical experience (ex. how I would react under a stressful situation). Overall it was relatively easy since I was prepared with situational responses.
Interview Questions: If you had a lot of things to handle how would you prioritize your day/patients?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: There is a one on one interview with the research coordinator and the principal investigator. The questions ranged from research experiences to personal knowledge, and there is a strong emphasis for MS Office skills.
Interview Questions: What skills have you learned from your past research experience and how can it be applicable here?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place with human resources that asked general questions and then the second interview question was with the department director. The wait was very long even though you were scheduled to come in at a certain time. Then the salary, work hours, benefits were briefly reviewed with you.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where a problem occurred with a patient or co-worker and how you resolved it.

title: Research Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: i was asked to come for an in person interview with my PI and i was asked what were my experiences in the similar field. and why I was interested in the position.
Interview Questions: why do you want to join Langone

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and casual. Listened to the PI as she described her various projects and then went through my resume explaining my experience. No difficult questions. The interviewer probed where she felt that it was relevant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current position? What's drawing you to this position?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: it was okay, It was somewhat intrusive a little just for an interview on my personal life. I did get accepted so I'm okay with that. title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I attended the Nurse Residency Preview Day, with about 12 new grads. We took a math calculation test (which was easy, don't worry) and the recruiter explained the program, the hospital, and benefits/salary to us. Then the recruiter spoke about what floors were hiring and which were already at capacity for new grads. We then met one-on-one very briefly to hand in our resumes and tell her where we were interested in going department wise.

- There really wasn't any interview type questions, just go with some ideas about what areas you're interested in.

That same week I was contacted about my availability to meet with a nurse manager and the following week I interviewed with the floor. It was very conversational, not intimidating. They did ask "Why nursing?" "Why this floor?" things of that nature and they also explained the floor to me and how they work together. I interviewed with the nurse manager and the charge nurse (again it was not nerve-wrecking or anything). Go in confident and ask questions (How do you find new grads adapt, Are you always at capacity, Nurse-Pt ratio, Have any nurses on the floor done the New Grad program..). Also make sure to get the names of the people you're interviewing with, so you can send a thank you email later that day.

- Some tips: don't be afraid to email/call people to follow up. After getting the call about my availability for the unit interview, I didn't hear anything for several days. I sent an email to the recruiter and she gave me the contact info for the person in charge of making appointments. I called and she had simply forgotten to schedule a day, she told me to call later and I did, that afternoon I received an email confirmation for the second interview. (Don't let something like that keep you from a second interview, remember they have lots of people to schedule so sometimes you have to remind them)
Interview Questions: Why oncology?
