Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a pleasant experience. The TAS person was very professional, forthright and patiently answered my questions. She went over the various openings that she was interviewing for, took notes and told me that she would submit my resume to the appropriate hiring managers.
Interview Questions: What departments would you be interested in working in?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Hr was great make me feel very comfortable. She made it more like and natural conversation then more so very efficient which is a huge stress realeaver.  Ask all her questions with a smile.
Interview Questions: What to do in a situation

title: Business Planning and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied via my school's career portal. I found out that they were looking to fill a classmate's position and I had her send out a little note for me after my phone screen. I interviewed with 2 people (one of them was late to the interview, which din't come off well). The questions were pretty generic and I think I answered them well. One of the major constraint is that I am an international student and it is possible that the department had issues with HR clearance for students on CPT/OPT.
Interview Questions: What are your immediate plans after graduation?

title: PACS Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took about 6 months and calling every month about the job posting before they called. They have the job posted week after week and month after month. I would have assumed I would have heard from them and not have to haunt them to review my resume.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for NYU?

title: Allied Health Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: interview process was very informal. It was one-on-one. No behavioral questions and very little technical questions were asked. The interview was more of a chatting session. My guess is they really needed someone with my background (chinese speaking) for the position.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call and asked to come in for an interview. Before I was interviewed by the nurse recruiter, I had to take a test which included pharmacology questions, drug calculations and what patients would be seen first.
Interview Questions: One question that surprised me was what nursing theorist/philosophy you follow.

title: Secretary I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very effective and streamlined. Had a phone screen and was then immediately booked for an interview. Recruiter was very helpful in answering questions. On the same day of the interview I got to meet managers as well as staff and get a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: How do you handle pressure?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line and got asked for an interview in a few days. Went in the following week and met with the lab manager and some of the people that worked in the lab, who showed me around. It mostly felt casual, which I liked. After that interview, I was called back for a second interview to speak with the lead researchers in the lab. A week later I was accepted for the position.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: sent application through the HR web site. Received a phone call and did pre-screen interview over the phone. Was called in for an interview, discussed project, schedule, job responsibilities,
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with IRB submissions and regulations?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager and then with my immediate supervisor. Both happened on the same day and both went well. I really enjoyed speaking to both and they kept things light but straight to the point.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NYU?

title: Senior Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of phone interviews and then the in person interview with the director, project managers and associate director. The process moved along but the scheduling was a bit delayed and not very clear.
Interview Questions: How do you like to organize my work?

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this position consisted in first taking tests of proficiency with software. The next step in the interview process was meeting with someone from the human resources office. For this position some basic behavioral questions were asked, but mostly the human resources person addressed the details of the position itself.
Interview Questions: For this position some basic behavioral questions were asked, but mostly the human resources person addressed the details of the position itself.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Submitted the application materials on line. One week later, got a chance to have a face to face meeting with a human resource staff. The interview took about 10 minutes. The staff was a very serious lady. She  was asking about the questions while looking at the resume.
Interview Questions: How many people are you managing?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very standardized process. Every week they interview about 30-40 students and organize events for them on a two-day schedule. The interviews take place on the second day (first day they show them around the med center, and have a nice dinner planned with actual grad students and professors). Each applicant is assigned to 3 PIs who he/she will talk to for about 30 minutes each. In my case one of them had an emergency so it was only two. On the written application you can actually put a couple PI names that you would like to talk to as part of your interview process but it does not guarantee anything. Depending on the PI, your interview will be a chat about yourself, your previous research experience, why you are applying to grad school, and then you should ask about their research. If you're clever, you have read one of their papers already and that will impress them. The interviews are really laid back, in the end it really feels like a conversation about science and research. Some PIs may have an exercise to test your analytical mind, but I haven't experienced it.
Interview Questions: "So, tell me why you are here."

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about an hour long. Took 3 weeks before actual meeting. Management seems confused when it comes to hiring process. All in all the process was average. Interviewer was friendly however seemed socially awkward. Tone of voice was high pitched at times then very low. Some questions were off tangent and didn't pertain to job position.
Interview Questions: What are 3 values essential for job success?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online first. Then, after a couple of weeks, I got an interview with HR in the morning and then my director in the afternoon. I got a job offer a week later, and then I started the following week. Overall, it took about a month.
Interview Questions: How you qualify for the position?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: interview was good I spoke to HR on the phone, set up an interview to meet manager and supervisors. Meet them and two days got called in to speak with two more supervisor than got called offering a salary
Interview Questions: what are your weakness

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I met with one of the HR representatives. Interview was pretty cordial and direct, She told me the position was not full-time and was indeed part-time and I thought I nailed the position due to my credentials but she seemed not too interested in me to begin with from the negative aura I felt within the interview. Any who I checked the status of my application online and through email and never received a response back but my application was still under review and the status had not changed for the position to be filled, I called again after a month of no response and the HR told me that the department had chose another person. Which is okay I just think it's a little unprofessional for an employer not to give you a heads up if you did not nail a position with them..
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Bioinformatician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview with several interviewers separately. In the arrangement, each interview would last 45 min, though it lasted 15 to 30 min. As a result, I had to wait for a long time in the hospital. All the interviewers were friendly, but I didn't perform well.
Interview Questions:
How to present RNA-seq data to customers.
About my projects.

title: Open House Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very organized open house. Registration took time since there were a lot of applicants for the open house. Didn't have to wait very long for my turn once the registration was complete. Very interactive interview. The only drawback here is they take very long to get back and very slow with follow ups to an extent of no response to my emails. Follow up was disappointing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What are your short term and long term goals? Why do you want to work for NYU Langone?

title: Treasury Representatives Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online got email to set up phone interview with HR , it easy just sound upbeat basic questions the set up face to face interview with HR and manager for department questions about time management and organizations skills manager interview was casual
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process was tedious and long because HR is not very effective. Not too helpful in coordinating various interviews quickly. Recruiter did not have much information about the position. Benefits were not well described.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fine. I was informed I got the internship but nothing happened after. It has been 5 months and I haven't started interning because there is no communication from their side anymore. They took a month to get my medical sorted. HR is unresponsive. All I hear from the person I interviewed with is that he is following up. This is highly unprofessional. They have no respect for my time. I kept following up as I was looking forward to the internship, but after months of hearing " we're working on it" I have given up. They have wasted my time completely. It is a shame to be apart of such a unorganized medical centre.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to intern here?

title: Manager Faculty Group Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with HR
In person interview with HR
In person interview with direct supervisor 
Job advertisement misrepresented actual position available. 
Need to ask specifically where the job will be located.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Dental Resident Aegd (Post Graduate Training) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Lutheran program director first and then with the individual dental site directors of each separate satellite clinic that had openings available (for post-match).  The program director interview was in Brooklyn, NY, and then the interviews with individual site directors were throughout New York City and even one in Jersey City, NJ, so the interview process did involve a commute.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about our program?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I went in for a first interview and then was called back in for a second interview. Travel expenses were not paid for by the hospital. At the interview I talked to several people in the lab about what they do, though they didn't ask many questions about what I do.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward; be prepared to answer questions pertaining to your previous jobs etc. Before being interview by the Department's hiring manager, you will need to complete the normal HR stuff. You will be asked general HR questions; you may also be required to take a test to prove your skills.
Interview Questions: If you're hired, what can you offer the Department?

title: Assistant Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions:
Back 12 years ago, their HR page used to list the name and contact of recruiters who were in charge of types of jobs you were applying. So, I just e-mailed that person asking her to distribute my resume to all faculty members in certain departments of my interest. I was then contacted by several faculty members for interviews. 

However, my recent dealing with the HR tells me that they are not serious about their job or incompetent. They do not seem to know the difference between biomedical research in a lab setting and clinical research. They also do not know the difference between a biomedical research lab and phlebotomy lab. They think that if you can run PCR and pipet in the lab, you can also draw blood from patients.
Interview Questions: I decided to interview only with a faculty member in cancer research. She asked about my knowledge of immunology, lab techniques, my publication records etc.

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 5 people at once. Then I was interviewed by the doctor and nursing staff. It was a process but worth it . Afterwards I had about a week or two of training. The group panel interview was the hardest part
Interview Questions: What do you consider a weakness of yours ?

title: Clinical Engineering Equipment Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Easy yet completely unorganized. Applied on the website and was called in by HR. HR then set up a follow up interview with the Clinical Engineering Management group. HR mixed up and changed the days of the interview on the day off the interview. Since I had made the trip I insisted I be interviewed that same day instead of the last minute reschedule. 

No communication between HR and Clinical Engineer to coordinate once they needed to reschedule.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in the equipment planning field?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I got an interview through my school career website. 
I was asked to go down to the medical center and the interview lasted for about 2 hours.
I first met the clinical psychologist who was in charge of the project and then the PI who had was an MD. Then, I had a chance to speak to current research team members.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this clinical research assistant position?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It was very uncomfortable for me.  I felt like they were very rushed and I was just part of an assembly line.  There people in the Human Resources offices were not very friendly or helpful.
They didn't even want to lend me a pen.  Also the office was very hot.
Interview Questions: What I would do in certain situations

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back a few weeks later with an invitation to interview. Interview was in New York and was conducted with a few faculty members affiliated with the program.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NYU Langone?

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process starts off with a preliminary conversation and is followed by interviews with senior management. The entire process was very comfortable and casual and never put me in any stress. This was the best part of the process. There are overall 3-4 rounds with different executives in the firm.
Interview Questions:
What is your previous experience?
How have you handled difficult situations?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Clinical Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 separate rounds with the exec's and the director. I was asked about hospital record management and research related questions. Time length was about an hour. The interviews started on time. My interviewees had a script, but we're also very flexible and let me show them my publication. They were also very understanding of train hassles.
Interview Questions: How will you develop our research program?

title: FGP Senior Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Onboarding consisted of several steps where I ended up interviewing with ~ 6 people and that does not include coming in to interview with HR afterwords. Then you had to pass Microsoft exams (Excel, Outlook), a typing test, and complete training for their software.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: 3+ weeks had do visit onsite 3 times. Once for a group interview. Interviews themselves were easy, nothing unexpected. I was exposed to some of the data available to the group and had to give my feedback to demonstrate understanding. The group interview was held over coffee and focused on my past experience in the field.
Interview Questions: none.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Application process took about three months. From. I was then contacted by Human resources for a prescreening via phone. Two weeks after that I was called in for an interview that was long and grueling.
Interview Questions: I was mainly asked about my qualifications which were all up to date and went above and beyond the minimum required by this particular institution.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to an open house event for MA's and billers and was emailed back to set up an phone interview. I did great on the phone interview and was selected to come in for an in person interview. I guess I did a great job on the in person interview, then I had an final interview with the Office manager in which I met and interviewed with and a few days later I had a job offer.
Interview Questions: Please describe your daily job responsibilities?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I learned about the opportunity through a colleague at my school.  I submitted my resume via email and was notified by another person to come for an interview.  I was interviewed by a panel of women for 30 minutes.  They asked me about the project I worked on in my last role and what are some important qualities when working in a team environment.  It seemed to go well but waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: What is the most important quality when working in a team environment?

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the job through glassdoor and received a response from human resources within two weeks requesting for an interview.  The day of the interview, I was interviewed by the site director and Human Resources in two different buildings.  After my interview, I received a phone call within a week with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding my experience related to the job i was applying for.

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at New York University Langone Hospital for their residency positions was pretty standard compared to other residency programs. I interviewed with about 4 professors there. I also met with the 3 program directors and the chief residents. They provided a tour of at least 2 of the hospitals. The interview program lasted most of the day. They also had a really great dinner with the residents already working in the program before and after the actual interview date, with a couple options to choose from.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to New York City for medical training.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Met with HR department
Met with Head of home care PT Department and VP for hospital rehab
They asked for background info with experience and my specializations
Asked my experience with different EMR applications
Interview Questions: Tell us about your home care experience and previous caseload

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had the worst experience with NYU. I applied for the job in August, got a call in early October for an interview for the end of October. I went in, interviewed with 6 different people including HR and it took about five hours. I had to go to a different building for HR and then come back to finish up the interview. Everyone in the department said I would be a great fit, but I didn't hear back until November when I emailed asking about the position. They filled it with someone who had direct experience. In December I got a call asking if I would still be interested in the job, the person they hired quit. I received an offer, sat with HR, went over what my first day would be like, and never heard from them again. Called two weeks later and was told they were still interviewing. I would never work for them.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the department?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 in-person interviews with the research coordinators of the study. They asked me behavioral questions. We talked more in detail about the experiences I had listed on my resume, particularly those of research background. We talked about my long-term career goals as well. Since the schedule is random, they ask about whether you are flexible and adaptable to different situations.
Interview Questions: They asked me about a time where I had to change my communication for an audience.

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with recruiter and manager for the floor I was going to work for. Also took a test to test my skills. The wait time was almost 2 hours, so I suggest if your traveling out of town to prepare accordingly. However, I don;t know if that was a particularly busy day. Overall, the interview felt relaxed and more conversational.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to the recruiting office after I had applied for a number of positions online. I was then put through to a senior recruiter who scheduled a time for me to come in and interview with her. After that interview, I was put in contact with another recruiter who set up an interview with a hiring manager on the particular unit with availability.
Interview Questions: If you are completely overwhelmed during the day with multiple discharges and admissions, tell me how you would prioritize your day.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through the website it took a week-interviewed at NYU Langone Medical Center
Very quick and direct questions with clear expectations, starting with tell me about yourself and your research experience.
Interview Questions: There was no unexpected question.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, direct questions clear list of expectations as well as a brief interview about past experience and future goals. The interviewer was friendly and got straight to the point.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected or difficult questions. I was asked about work ethic and previous projects.

title: Rehab Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: applied directly and got an email requesting for a face to face interview. Interview was straight forward, then went to HR to fill out an application on paper. found out within a few days. Went onsite for health screening
Interview Questions: very straight forward

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Apply Online, receive Battery test through email, scheduled interview with HR two days later with dosage calc test, then sent for interview with Nurse manager. Pretty quick and seamless process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you were challenged

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Found a potential employer through collaborators. The position was not advertised so I contacted future employer (PI, Principal Investigator) via e-mail. I was invited for a formal interview (one on one including meeting all lab members and a PowerPoint presentation of previous PhD work). I got a response within the following 2 weeks and I took the position.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to our research group that we don't currently have?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Recruited through college, basic phone interview and and after that came into the office for an in-person behavioral interview. Afterwords, I was also interviewed by the manager of the department I was working for, where I was asked questions about my resume.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation you were under a lot of pressure?

title: Senior FGP Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume, I got a call from HR Dept the very next day to schedule an interview! Interview day was very pleasant and informative. Staff and interviewer was very courteous and professional.  Lot of electronic paperwork involved in the process and testing. Make sure to always have all your records up to date and any certifications or degrees. Overall pleasant experience so far!
Interview Questions: No difficult questions at all basic questions.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked 5 basic competencies like critical thinking, time management skills.  Fairly straight forward and easy. She asked about my previous experience and how it would apply to the job I was seeking.
Interview Questions: Draw on prior examples of dealing with difficult people

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Study your interviewers during the process. Look up papers and a general idea of what is done in each lab. Show interest into their research. Ask for the respective list of interviewers as early as possible.
Interview Questions: Many, but remember to never lie. When in doubt just say I don't know.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two days, met with four different people, all very nice. It was a phone interview, and two subsequent interviews with team leads and directors of the department. All asked questions about my vision of healthcare and how I would execute said vision.
Interview Questions: What was my vision for healthcare and how did I think it should be carried out.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was a strictly behavioral interview. i talked about all of my experiences that led me up to this point. we also discussed the study and what my role would be.
Interview Questions: tell me about "x" experience

title: EMR Implementation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone screen with HR and 1 interview with Director; followed by several phone calls with HR to negotiate salary.  Process was a bit confusing at fist because HR mixed up which role I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Ability to manage multiple work streams

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview on site after submitting my CV and cover letter. They had 200 applicants, interviewed 25 people and extended offers to 2. Talked to both P.I. and the current RAs.
Interview Questions: General knowledge questions -- tell me about yourself, why do you want to work in this lab?

title: FGP Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was frustrating because I applied for the job months in advance of my college graduation. I only got called for an interview after someone in senior management passed along my resume. It was also frustrating that while having my bachelors degree I was only interviewed for a job requiring a GED. The interview process itself was typical, meet with HR rep, meet office management, continue with HR policies.
Interview Questions: what skills would you bring the office?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Entry level tech job for a structural biology lab. Interviewed with professor and lab manager, then lab tour and briefly talking with postdocs in the lab. The entire interview last around 3 hours.
Interview Questions: research experience

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied this position online. After one month, I got an phone interview with HR. After another month, they offered me an onsite interview. During the onsite, I met almost all members in the research group. They are all friendly and nice guys. They basically discussed my experience on my resume and some simple technique questions. After one week, I got the official offer.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute our group with your experience?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process might have multiple rounds of interviews. Standard telephone interview, questionnaires and interview questions. Some impressive new facilities.
Interview Questions: mainly standard interview questions. Long hiring cycle.

title: Billing Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my application online.  
Initially there was a telephone.  Following that I scheduled a one on one interview with HR. Honestly that went pretty well.  The company is very organized and professional. Each step is according to an order and of course if they are interest or your interested also. 
I waited possible two weeks and finally was called for the interview with the hiring manager. She was nice we had a long interview I want to say a little more than an hour.  Of course I followed up with a thank you letter.  I believe I waited a week or possible two and then I got the call that I was selected. I was extremely excited and of course accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: General questions, what are your goals, what are your skills, how long have you been in this field etc.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied by emeailing the PI directly ans was invited to present my lab and talk to the lab staff. The process was well organised, got ample time to tour the lab facilities and speak with both research and administration staff.
Interview Questions: What is your specific research interest?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a group of five people. Only the head of the clininc was asking the question. The actual superviser that was hiring only asked one question. Easy Interview process. Long wait time on the outcome of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why Health Care?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Prior to interview I had to complete an online assessment and within a week I was contacted for an interview with a nurse recruiter. After interviewing with NR I met with a nurse manager for a second interview. The entire process was very efficient and everyone that I interacted with was respectful and warm.
Interview Questions: I was not asked situational questions. I was asked general questions about how I got into nursing and what I liked about the hospital and floor.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with PI of lab and had standard interview questions. Emailed directly with PI regarding interview process and he was flexible with times. Did not have to go through HR before meeting with PI.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our research? What draws you to being a research assistant? Where do you see yourself in the future.

title: Associate Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: applied online about a week or 2 later had a phone screening (basic ques...why you applied etc etc). Received an invitation for a in-person interview a week later with 4 people- each interview were to last 1/2 hr. The interviewers were alright- one interviewer told me he has no idea why they have him interviewing candidates.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Was an extern at the Hospital and was hired into the program after the interview. Was offered a great position and a salary. Definitely find externships as a student nurse.
Interview Questions: Keep up grades.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: phone screen with hiring manager, on site interview,
Interview Questions: nothing special, remember to use example to justify your answers

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were several interviews. Phone interview with the recruiter, one on one interview with the manager, director, and administrator. Also, had to take a Microsoft Access test. It was a long process.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself?

title: Diet Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: the process was short and straight to the point. The job responsibilities was explained to me and I was told what the dress code will be. I was asked what I was studying in at school at the time, it was something that was related to the position I was applying for.
Interview Questions: what experience do I have

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email inviting me to interview for a part-time school social worker position very shortly after applying. I met with 3 people who were all very friendly and made me feel at ease. They asked A LOT of questions and they were very specific, mostly aimed at getting an idea of how I would interact with the students. I don't think I've ever been asked so many questions during an interview. Just when I thought it was going to be over...another round of questions would come. They were all fairly straight forward though. 
It took much longer than the 2-weeks I was quoted to hear back from them but I always take time quotes like that at face value. I received a very friendly rejection, and while it never feels good to be turned down, I felt it was handled professionally and politely.
Interview Questions: One interviewer asked a question that was worded so oddly that the other 2 interviewers burst out laughing. I had to ask for clarification and I can't even remember what the question was.

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: I started as a post doc and climb the ladder over the years.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I found the email address of someone who incharge of extern and emailed him.
He contacted me and I had an interview with him. He was very nice and all the interview questions were not tricky.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with boss and went for interview in person later. Interview with the HR lastly. It takes sometime to schedule an interview with the HR. Other than that it was pretty fast.
Interview Questions: HR asks some typical questions i.e. what would you do if you see something

title: Assistant Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: made a presentation and then submitted three recommendation letters, then HR gave me the offer and told me the salary I will have. Then I went through the background checkup and health checkup
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Corporate Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial application was easy to complete. Took 2 weeks to hear back but then the interview 'in-person' portion was quick and easy. Everyone I met with was very friendly and interested in my past experience.
Interview Questions: Based on your experience, how can your skillsets add value to this position?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was only a single interview, conducted by the two administrative heads of the department. They were somewhat desperate for a replacement since the previous data analyst had quit with little notice. It was cordial and the questions were more to ascertain my background and experience, rather than on-the-spot tests of competency or ability. It was all very conversational, and I spoke more about how a certain TV show encapsulated by worldview rather than answering any specific questions. That said I was a recent college grad, and didn't really have anything of substance experience-wise to talk about anyway.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a long interview but really easy going, got different calls from people of several departments, but everybody was really really nice and receptive, my pi actually my direct boss was very interested on my experience, my goals and my knowledge
Interview Questions: About my research experience

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I had a scheduled day off, so I was able to meet with my interviewers during the day.  Although i did not get the position, they were very courteous and thorough, asking solid questions and responsive to my questions.  Clearly a fine-tuned team that I would have been happy to work with.

The H.R. Interview was quick and informative, right to the point about the organization and facilities.
Interview Questions: I have a fairly large recession-gap in my work history.  They did not ask too many questions on that, they were more interested in hearing about my current work experiences.

title: Patient Unit Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward very formal but not nerve racking everyone are polite and professional and they do follow up in a timely manner.The interview process was straight forward very formal but not nerve racking everyone are polite and professional and they do follow up in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and one in-person interview
Interview Questions: Standard Questions

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: 4 Rounds of Interviews, 6 people total
Interview Questions: None, but when I asked what a typical day in the life was, I was told (very rudely) to ask another question.

title: Temp Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very cordial.  I met with just one person and was given an offer letter the same day.  The easiness of the interview was probably due to the fact that it was obvious I was no spring chicken. The negative  rating is for their lack of work assignments and for their lack of consideration to look out for their chosen temps by ensuring a steady paycheck through steady work.  I learned too late that they do not care for temps especially when they "hire" over 200.  It's no wonder I still felt unemployed when they "hired" me.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years?

title: EMR Implementation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Through a recruiter, interview twice, once with director and once with team members. HR process took about 1-2 weeks for all the verification and paper works. painless interview experience.
Interview Questions: None, all questions expected, but perhaps the most difficult question was "how would you deal with difficult physicians and staff?"

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: very competitive and fair process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NYU Langone Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, head of lab explained what kind of job it was. Was invited to more formal interview where I can "see if it's really not for me." In-person interview with head of lab, then went to office to meet current research assistants. Interview questions were straight forward, but there was blatant racial stereotyping. Saw some patients. Was told I would be contacted within two months because there are  lot of other candidates for the position.
Interview Questions: Unexpected: What instrument did you play?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: My job was created for me in the department, but does not appropriately describe what I do. If the job is not already advertised you will have to be patient about getting the job through the HR dept.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: First I submitted an online application, then got flown out for around 6 in person interviews over two days visiting the medical center. Afterwards, it took a couple weeks for me to hear regarding the decision of my acceptance
Interview Questions: Tell me about a research paper you recently read

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with my PI in person for a short meeting. After that she asked me to give an hour research presentation to the lab members. It was big research group, therefor there were many questions. It was a good experience. I was hired after the interview.
Interview Questions: Besides receiving many research questions, I was asked why I want to leave my current position? Where else I am interviewing? What do I want to do in the future? If I prefer to stay in academia or industry.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Expected style interview. General fit and personality questions followed by specific questions about why I wanted to do that research, why that lab, then where do I see my research going, what would I like to do in the future/independent research. Had a tour of the lab - impressive facilities and met with each lab member for a 30 minute chat followed by lunch with all of the lab minus the PI.
Interview Questions: What do you think the next step would be in the project?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview first with the Director and then the Senior Director.
Interview Questions: Asked to submit a writing sample detailing items discussed in the interview.

title: Environmental Health & Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: In interviewed with the direct supervisor and an employee in the office. Once HR contacted me, it took about a month to clear through the background checks and paperwork.  HR is very thorough and efficient in moving the process along.  I have to say I am very impressed with them.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations?

title: Office Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with Senior Director, then proceeded to meet with HR.  After I met with HR, I had a second  interview with the department which was a working interview  Once the day was complete, the senior director met with me to discuss the days events.  She expressed her gratefulness of a job well done during the working interview and advised that if I was the chosen candidate, it would be a pleasure to work with me.  The following day, I met with Human Resources to and had a skills assessment and personality quiz.
Interview Questions: How can your skills contribute to NYU

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, transparent and clear on the duties that were required to fulfill the department vision.  It was a multiple interview process, while meeting with HR, three departmental manager and also lead staff members.
Interview Questions: My ability to work in a fast pace environment

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: My initial interview was with the administrator and the medical director for the department. It was one interview explaining what the job was and what the research trial they were starting up was about. It was a very general interview. The whole interview itself was quick. The administrator made it seemed like it was urgent to have someone get started as soon as possible. I was offered the job and started less than two weeks later. Unfortunately, the study was no where near ready to start up so I was doing nothing for about two months.
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience in research.

title: Contract Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR and they asked me questions.  I then met with the director, manager and senior staff in the department.  They asked me a series of questions and wanted to gauge my knowledge of transactional law specifically clinical contracts.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with working with clinical contracts

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR nurse recruiter after attending an open house held at NYULMC. Then was called by HR and met with the director of my unit for an in person interview. Then was called to HR for an in person benefits overview (I did not negotiate my salary. I regret not doing this. If you have experience try to negotiate because at NYULMC mgmt expects a lot of involvement outside of patient care) and brief cardiac rhythm test.
Interview Questions: Director of my unit told me about the current unit and gave me a tour. I met with the director 1 on 1. She asked questions such as: Tell me about the types of patients you currently see and have experience with? Tell me where you see yourself in 5 years? How well do you work with others? Gave me some behavioral questions like: what would you do in a high stress situation or a confrontational situation. Some questions I asked: What are some of the future goals of the unit? What are some projects and quality improvement initiatives currently underway on the unit? How cohesive is the current unit?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was very quick. I sent my CV directly to a PI. Got response right away. Scheduled an interview in a couple of weeks. The interview process included one-on-one meeting with my future boss, then meeting with each lab member, then power point presentation of my research, lunch with the future boss, meeting with the director of postdoctoral program, then a seminar on related topic but presented by a different speaker. A day-long interview.
Interview Questions: Experience in biomedical sciences

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I underwent two separate 45-minute behavioral interviews. They were very structured and pretty straightforward. There was a heavy emphasis on teamwork & collaboration and customer service, so be sure to prepare examples around those themes. The interviewers were very friendly and not at all intimidating. Authenticity and thoughtfulness are very much valued here.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you provided exceptional customer service.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: We talked about the job and its qualifications as well as my own background in the field. It was a very good experience; In addition, they talked of the many different programs the hospital offered as well as CME.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: the manager was nice and it was easy at this time when i interviewed. I was a new grad and got hire din the ICU which was exciting. Good long orientation
Interview Questions: why should we hire you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview for this company went well.  Manager was very nice and asked quite a few questions about how can I benefit their company. The location was very nice and clean.  Patients were a bit rude at times but I guess that comes with the territory in healthcare.
Interview Questions: How is your punctuality

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted in the lab. 2 people interviewed me. It lasted for maybe around 30-45 minutes. They wanted to know about the research I did prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: Q: What did I see myself contributing here and why did I want to work here?

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: They reviewed my resume and told me that I might be a good fit for the position so then they told me they would call me back with an interview date. Didnt hear from them for about 2 weeks, then they called me in for the interview, they said they would be in contact, didnt hear from them for another 3 weeks.  They finally called me in saying i got the job and was suppose to report for a physical, when i got the physical then about 2 weeks later i started. so all in all it took about a couple months.
Interview Questions: none, pretty average stuff, why do you want to work here, what can you bring to the company, etc., etc.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Human Resources and interview with the head of the Pulmonary Research Department.  In Human Resources, I was asked all the basic questions and in the pulmonary department, I was asked about my rotations in college, what units I worked in, if I had training with PFT's(Pulmonary Function Testing).
Interview Questions: Have I worked with PFT's (Pulmonary Function Testing)?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The initial application consisted of recommendation letters from former professors (and or employers), grades and essay. After the interview offer, you were flown to NYU Langone Medical Center for a series for interviews with faculty from whichever program you have the most interest in. You find out about your acceptance roughly 2 weeks - 2 months after the initial interview and department heads contact you directly to help you with making your decision between their program and other schools.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do science ?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview 1:1, followed by meeting team, employee to be replaced by myself, and group presentation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Short interview process. Submitted resume to HR and got a phone call from Office Manager. Came in for an interview. HR took over a month to process my paperwork. Had to keep calling.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. Only about resume experiences.

title: NOT Interested In Disclosing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Sent in as a temporary/contract
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Great location, great staff, lots of very smart and hardworking people, overall it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Describe how you overcame adversity in your life.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview was mostly about my PhD research and how it can be applied to the lab research projects. Since I worked in the same area, it went very well and I got an offer at the end of the interview. The position wasn't advertised, I heard about the opening from a friend and emailed the PI my CV. The whole process took about two weeks.
Interview Questions: I got questions about my family which I didn't expect, but didn't mind answering.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: The whole took a 3 months. Everyone what to feel important so they make you come back for no reason. Questions were very forward, the usual stuff.. why you want to work here, educational background.....
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NYU Langone Health (New York, NY) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions:
I contacted through email and expressed my interest in the lab and the research that it is into. 
I was asked to transfer three reference letters. 
I was invited for a one on one interview that was one hour long.
I was invited for a second interview in which several additional ideas that the boss didnt cover at the first place were brought up.
I was invited to give a presentation to the lab.
I was taken to lunch by one of the boss colleagues.
Interview Questions: why would you like to change field ?
